Crimes.Crime_Name: False representation or fraud in obtaining citizenship
Legal_Issue: Does the applicant have standing to challenge the Governor in Council's decision not to revoke Mr. Odynsky's citizenship?
Governing_Law: Section 18.1(1) of the Federal Courts Act
Outcome: The appeal is allowed, and the motion to strike is dismissed.
Procedural_Context: Judicial review application under the Federal Courts Act
Basis_of_Claim: Challenge to non-revocation of citizenship based on alleged fraud
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Applicant's lack of direct standing; arguable public interest standing
Proceeding_Type: Appeal from striking out application for judicial review
Review_Outcome: Motion to strike dismissed; appeal allowed
Legal_Standard: Standing under Section 18.1(1); public interest standing criteria
Decision_Outcome: Standing issue remitted for determination during judicial review hearing
Decision_Review_Issue: Existence of standing for judicial review
Procedural_Issue: Striking out application for lack of standing

Crimes.Crime_Name: Knowingly concealing material circumstances in obtaining citizenship
Violation_Type: Improper exercise of discretion in citizenship revocation
Legal_Issue: Does the applicant have standing to challenge the Governor in Council's decision not to revoke Mr. Odynsky's citizenship?
Governing_Law: Section 18.1(1) of the Federal Courts Act, Section 10 of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Applicant (League for Human Rights) claims involvement in war crimes justice and represents victims' families
Decision_Outcome: Appeal allowed; application for judicial review reinstated
Court_Ruling: Public interest standing is fairly arguable; motion to strike dismissed
Claimant_Status: Non-governmental organization acting in public interest
Defendant_Behavior: Failure to revoke citizenship despite alleged grounds
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged improper discretion under Section 10 of the Citizenship Act
Legal_Standard: Standing under Section 18.1(1); public interest standing test
Assessment_Factor: Seriousness of the issue, applicant’s genuine interest, absence of alternative challenger
Procedural_Issue: Striking out application due to alleged lack of standing
Evidence_Used: Affidavits and representations regarding war crimes advocacy
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 18.1(1), Federal Courts Act; Section 10, Citizenship Act
Application_Basis: Public interest in accountability for historical war crimes
Relief_Sought: Order for judicial review of non-revocation decision
Outcome: Appeal allowed; motion to strike dismissed
Harm_Assessment: Perceived failure to uphold integrity of citizenship process
Cause_Description: Challenge to non-revocation of citizenship over concealment allegations
Misrepresentation_Element: Concealment of material facts during citizenship process
Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal court jurisdiction over citizenship decisions
Decision_Rationale: Public interest standing may apply given nature of claim
